content.question: Which of the following most directly explains how the values Hobsbawm discusses in the first paragraph were undermined in the interwar period?

choices.label: Economic instability, combined with fears of another war, allowed fascist states to emerge as liberal institutions collapsed.
New states that emerged in eastern Europe lacked the national unity required to create effective liberal governments.
British and French preparations for another war against Germany undermined those nationsâ€™ liberal political institutions.
The Bolshevik Revolution in Russia inspired similar communist revolts in newly created eastern and central European states.

content.answer: Economic instability, combined with fears of another war, allowed fascist states to emerge as liberal institutions collapsed.

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
